alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 3:33PM MST until July 23 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 328 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring on Schultz Creek. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar. This includes the following highways... Highway 180 between mile markers 218 and 219. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring along Schultz Creek. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
